newsitem.title: USA: Sylvan sees Q2 gain of $1.5 million.
newsitem.headline: Sylvan sees Q2 gain of $1.5 million.

text.p: Sylvan Learning Systems Inc said Friday it will record an earnings gain of $1.5 million in the second quarter as a result of a merger break-up fee less expenses and investments.

Sylvan said it expects to make one-time investments and expenditures of about $22 million in the quarter to strengthen its earnings potential and shelter the tax impact of the previously announced $28.5 million gain it will record, after transaction-related costs, from the break-up of its planned merger with National Education Corp.
The company received a break-up fee of $30 million from National Education, which has announced a merger with Harcourt General Inc.

Sylvan said it expects to record a loss of about $4 million in the second quarter from impairment of assets resulting from certain strategic changes made as a result of the contemplated merger with National Education.
